title: Thanks to the brilliant NHS
body:
Having spent 6 days in the Scunthorpe Hospital I am pleased to be writing this review in the comfort of my home.

May I say a really big thank you to all staff, whatever level, for taking care of me.

The staff work so hard, nothing is too much trouble. With such a stressful job your smiles provides a feeling of comfort.

I loved the unity too. Ward 25 always ran smoothly and that’s down to a great team.

I have nothing but admiration and thanks for the brilliant service you gave me.

Thank you so much.

Warm Regards

David Batchelor

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: POOR PRACTICE
body: I have found sadly that the doctors are rather inexperienced and seem to be  reluctant to perform an actual physical examination of the patient.They do appear to be "chained to their computers"and are very happy to send you for blood tests,etc.and to refer you to hospital but asking you to undress and to be examined appears to be a step too far for them.If they were full time doctors I think that their performance would improve.

title: Great Dietician Services
body:
With diet increasingly seen as important for our well-being it is so good to have a dietician service within the Practice linking in seamlessly with our general health-care, making teh service range more complete.
I received excellent advice and follow-up with definite benefits to my health and energy levels.

title: Mistakes at every turn
body:
My partner is awaiting surgery. The process of seeing a consultant and getting treated has proceeded at a glacial pace with mistakes at all stages. He has twice been booked in for the wrong procedure (we have cancelled a long-awaited holiday in vain) and we do not know when this will all be resolved.

It is all extremely upsetting and I do not know what to do to help resolve it. Feeling hopeless.

author: Izod
title: Skin Cancer
body:
I had a scary diagnosis last year and was operated on with a skin graft . I have had planned follow up with radiotherapy and supervision ever since under the care of Mr Salam and his team at the Queen Victoria Hospital including Maggie and the MacMillan nurses . Also with the Oncologist Dr Simpson at the Sussex County . I want to pay tribute to the kindness , concern and professionalism of all involved .  
My Dad was a patient here in his 90`s but first visited in 1941 when he was in the RAF to see one of their pilots . I qualified in Medicine in 1969 Mr Salam is one of the best universally respected Surgeons I`ve known .Thank you Mr Salam and East Grinstead .

readBy.name: Queen Victoria Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: golfingbuddy
title: Ward 26 emergency admission
body:
Admitted with a fever following a cystoscopy over the last two weeks (two admissions) to ward 26, I would like to thank all the staff for the care and kindness shown to me throughout all my treatment. Thanks so much to the NHS in these difficult times.  
Stay Safe many thanks again

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Great practice
body: Quick and easy consultation over phone. Spoke to surgery after 8am and by 9:30 am I already had spoken with GP and all sorted.

title: Rude receptionist again
body: This has been my surgery for many years and fortunately I haven’t needed to attend too often. However whenever I do, often there’s a female receptionist with nigh on zero interpersonal skills. Appreciate that patients need to provide succinct information as demand is high, but when you are already feeling anxious about an issue, her approach can only be described as rude. She cuts you short whilst disclosing symptoms, has a short sharp attitude, questions your legitimacy and appears to want to make you feel silly. A little customer service training is long overdue!

title: Appointment via phone
body:
Due to our present situation,my appointment was arranged via a phone call.
The receptionist was very helpful when I rang and explained the situation asked for my details and said a nurse would call me back.
On receiving call,I was dealt with in  a very kind understanding way, and my prescription was sent to a pharmacy of my choice.
Really great service ,Thankyou so much to the two lovely ladies who debt with my problem.

title: great people
body: just had a video chat with one of the team doctors over my health, they listened to me and understud me,they have helped me 100% over whats happened so am very great full for there help, would like to say a big thanks, for your help.

readBy.name: North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Great Doctors. Rude Reception.
body: I have been a patient of this GP Surgery since I was a child and I am very fond of the doctors. Having said this, some of the reception staff are extremely rude, unprofessional and speak harshly (and this has been happening for years, so has nothing to do with the recent pandemic). There is one person who also clearly needs to be replaced from being on the phone, as they can never clearly hear anything you say and shout at you in an accusatory way -asking 'What do you want?' (yes, that is word for word how I've been spoken to as a sick patient calling in)- as if you're just being silent on purpose to waste their time. The rude individuals should absolutely not be working in a job that is patient facing. Any time I attend the surgery, I actively avoid the reception and attempt to use the self-service device wherever possible. They show utter annoyance at answering any questions and talk to you in a condescending and irritated tone, like you're stupid for even asking anything. I now feel some anxiety every time I have to call and often use the Islington Hub service instead, just to avoid this awful interaction with The Northern Medical Centre's reception staff. It saddens me that The Practice feels this is an appropriate way to talk to their patients, as they have not done anything about it.

title: Very good service
body: Polite, friendly attentive staff. I was seen on time and given full information.  Although I should say that this was during a time when few people were attending the health centre because of covid 19. However I think the staff would have been just as proficient and attentive anyway

title: Extremely prompt service
body:
Left a message on the surgery website through the consultation tool at 2100hrs and had the problem solved by 930 the next morning, great response - better than amazon prime!
Keep up the good work and stay safe in these difficult times

title: Fast, efficient and personal care
body: "Typical middle aged man" leaves calling the doctor too late and after 2 days of foot pain calls the surgery to make an appointment. Within the hour, got a call back and through clever tech uploaded pictures of my swollen foot in real time to receive the "typical middle aged man" diagnosis: gout! Prescription sent to my nearest pharmacy and now wishing I'd done this 48 hours earlier. Great service and thankful that our local surgery is operating in such an innovative way. Will call them sooner next time

title: Great doctors, awful receptionists
body: It's very difficult to make an appointment, the reception staff are more often rude than not when telephoning, and I have been asked more than once by reception staff to describe my symptoms when telephoning.  I called to make an appointment with a trained and qualified professional, not someone whose principal purpose seems to be to make it as difficult for me to make an appointment as they can.

title: Excellent care
body: My cousin was admitted to Bramshott ward on Friday 27th March 2020. Because of Covid19 I was unable to visit her but every day the staff telephoned me with the news of how she was. I found this daily message so helpful and comforting. Not being able to hold her hand and boost her moral was very difficult so those messages were just what I needed. I would really like to send all the staff on Bramshott Ward a huge thank you for caring for her. I am only sorry that they did not know her as the fun and amusing sometimes feisty and testing person she was. She had a difficult life but rarely complained. Thank you all again for your care and I hope you all stay safe and well as is the saying now!

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unhappy
body: We are no happy as my dad as got skin cancer and we have been waiting since he lockdown for a biopsy which we got told is urgent but it keeps getting cancelled now m dads condition as got worse and you want him to travel to Grantham or Boston which he is to frail to get to them

title: Great practice
body:
In the midst of the coronavirus pandemic I was able to speak to a GP within ten minutes of calling.
The advice I was given was appropriate and reassuring.

author: oramad
title: Removal of catheter after prostate surgery
body:
I attended the Urology Diagnostic Treatment Centre at Queen Margaret Hospital, Dunfermline in April 2020 to have a catheter removed after prostate surgery. This was the second time as I had to go back to hospital to have it refitted due to suffering great pain and being unable to pass urine after 48 hours.  
The nurses at Queen Margaret were extremely good and patient with me, answering all my questions and concerns - I was obviously concerned that I might have to go through the same ordeal again. I found the whole process as unstressful as it could have possibly have been and have subsequently had no further problems with pain or urine retention.  
The way I was treated was in marked contrast to the hospital where I originally had the catheter removed which was like being processed as quickly as possible with no attempt made to discuss the process I was undergoing or prepare me for any problems I might experience.

title: Situation explained so well
body: Amid all the drama going on around us with the virus couldn't believe how organised, professional and reassuring all staff I met were. My doctor gave me her opinion at the clinic after having a little procedure however she would then follow this up with a chat to her colleague and she would then phone me regarding next steps for my treatment which she did. Feel reassured and so grateful with how my referral, appointments and how I've been kept in the loop with my treatment.

author: mineraljc68
title: Brilliant service
body: I have been with CGL for a few months and they are brilliant! With everything going on with this Covid19 they still phone me regularly to ask how I am doing, I still get the scripts I need and the support I need.   Cannot fault the service.

author: stenhousemuir local
title: Receptionist attitude
body:
I was trying to get a prescription from my GP sent to balfron where I was staying due to the coronavirus lockdown. the receptionist on the phone had an attitude with me and refused to send a prescription to Balfron pharmacy. In the past 2 weeks this receptionist has spoken to me 3 times, told me doctors would call back as well and they never have. I honestly believe they have not been passing information on.  
Previously, this receptionist has tried to diagnose me over the phone instead of putting me throught to the doctors as well. I don't believe this person has much care for me as I suffer great anxiety and depression I struggle to sometimes get words out and they are very impatient with me.  
My experience at the surgery full and through is a shambles and has been for last year and when I was suffering depression a Dr at the surgery prescribed me propranolol which is an angina medication instead of an antidepressant, they never listened to me for weeks about symptoms and I had to visit forth valley larbert hospital mental health ward 4 times before I got any progression.  
When I was temporarily registered at another health centre they upped my sertraline to 100 mgs then when went back to stenhousemuir they only gave me 50 mg which resulted in a near mental break down due to the difference in medication. Also since I've been on sertraline for 6-7 weeks now they have not phoned at all to check on me when they said they'd call me 2-3 weeks into the treatment due to the potential suicidal side effects the medication has. ive honestly heard of other people being treated in these manners and like myself have to wait average 3-7 days for an appointment to see the doctor.  
The mental health nurse doesn't call when they are meant to either and isnt always available, all these problems have increased my anxiety and made me more reluctant to seek medical help as I've lost faith in my local NHS.

author: Bradac
title: Dental experience
body:
I started getting toothache two days after the Covid 19 clampdown, my dentist could not help but after a recommended phone call I was advised to ring the dental access centre. At that time they could not help because of lack of PPS equipment but gave me very good advice on pain management and suggested I phone weekly to see if they were in a position to see me. On the 14 April they were able to extract an upper rear molar but were concerned its neighbour might need attention, sure enough I started getting severe toothache again and after a phone call on the 22 April the offending molar was extracted the following day.  
I cannot fault in any way the excellent service I received, At all times I felt my care was uppermost, everything was explained fully and the teeth efficiently removed, afterwards it was made sure I was okay before I left. All in all a very impressive service, especially with all the pressures the NHS is going through at present

author: b12preg
title: B12 injection for pernicious anemia
body:
I receive B12 injections every 8-10 weeks for my pernicious anemia, the injections are administered by treatment room nurses.  
3 weeks ago I contacted the team to book my next appointment , I was told the service was not performing routine services due to Covid-19.  
I then explained that my injections were not routine to me and I considered them essential to my health and wellbeing. I also informed the staff I was 14 weeks pregnant. I was told to contact my GP service. I contacted my GP practice and explained that I was informed I could not receive my next injection. The receptionist was very helpful & discussed my issue with a GP who said I should have my injection given I was pregnant. The receptionist then booked my appointment with the treatment room nursing team for today. I was very relieved.  
Yesterday the nursing team contacted me to inform me the appointment would be a home visit and to check I had no Covid-19 symptoms. I then received no further contact from the treatment room until 3pm today when I contacted them to ask if a nurse was coming to my house. I was told they would phone me, I still haven't received any call from the treatment room nurses. I was contacted by a GP who informed me current guidance was I could miss this injection and get the next one, I explained this wasn't acceptable to me given I would experience symptoms which I didn't believe was appropriate given I am currently pregnant. I found the GP to be patronising and had a lack of care for my circumstances and feelings, they only seemed interested in guidance not my care. The whole event has left me stressed and upset. I currently work in the health service and I fully understand the difficult situation all healthcare workers are currently experiencing but I was disappointed that in this situation I felt that patient centred care was lacking. I feel the lack of communication regarding the cancelling of this vital (to me) service disappointing.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Fantastic CPN service
title: Mental health services
body: My son has been receiving care from the CPN service in NHS Dumfries and Galloway for several years. I would personally like to highlight Emma who provides excellent, compassionate and personable to not only my son, but to me, his mother as well. Recently due to Covid-19, mental health services took the decision to discharge a significant amount of their client base ensuring us that they were only at the end of the telephone. Due to be furloughed my son has been struggling and I have gained knowledge, guided my Emma of signs of crisis and today took the decision to call the service. I was delighted to learn that Emma had not been deployed and was still available to us so emailed her with details of how things were at home. At 7pm I received a call from Emma informing me that she had discussed my email with her team leader and my son’s consultant and the decision was to offer him an appointment on Tuesday. Amazing, first class, personable service! I cannot thank Emma enough. I know that I speak for both my son and myself when I say that we are extremely lucky to have Emma as a CPN at NHS Dumfries and Galloway.

author: Mummyforthe2ndtime
title: Pregnancy and home birth experience
body:
I recently gave birth and cannot praise the nhs and midwives highly enough for their care throughout my pregnancy and home birth.  
When around 8weeks pregnant I suffered with hyperemesis which resulted in being admitted to the unit at Aberdeen maternity hospital. The staff were amazing and although busy always had time for you and I felt very well looked after while there. They were thorough checking my bloods and any abnormalities as well as ensuring I was able to eat and drink before being sent home, they certainly did not rush this and with two extra scans and the correct medication I was sent home when they were sure I was well enough and not before.  
Although this was in Aberdeen the rest of my care was with the Peterhead team of midwives. Again all staff I had any dealings with were friendly,professional and always helpful. At all times I felt like they were understanding of any concerns or enquiries I had and were always happy to help or reassure me. My own midwife who I saw for routine appointments was especially so. From ensuring I was as well as possible by getting the correct medications (especially with the hyperemesis and later with acid reflux), to arranging all aspects of my home birth and helping with questions or concerns I had, I again always felt well looked after and that when it came to me and my baby they were happy to help.  
Although I was given a tour of the labour rooms at Peterhead, which were tempting to go for as they looked a lovely place to give birth, I decided to opt for a home birth. Again all questions I had regarding this were answered in a supportive and positive manner. Nearer the time my midwife visited my home, discussed my plans then arranged for everything we needed for the birth.  
When it came to labour my midwife was on call and was at my home within 30mins of phoning Peterhead and the second midwife was just a little after that too- thankfully as baby made a quick appearance so we didn't have much time to play with! I cannot rate my home birth experience highly enough, both midwives were professional, supportive and reassuring throughout and very much were led by my wishes in my birthing plan. This was during a time when co-vid 19 meant many of us had concerns and worries about how this would affect our labours, however my experience was extremely positive. All staff throughout my pregnancy, birth and first few days with baby deserve to be thanked and praised as I feel I had a great level of care thanks to them all!

author: Phoenix69
title: Surprised admission to HDU ward
body:
Having collapsed during the night, my partner convinced me to go A&E early the next morning as I was still in pain. Thinking back it was so stupid of me not to have called an ambulance straight away.  
Anyway, arriving at A&E I was fully examined by an amazing team and following ultrasound scans they suspected I had a ruptured spleen and was bleeding internally. A CT scan confirmed this was the case and I was immediately admitted to critical care (HDU) ward 116.  
The care I received was absolutely superb.The nurses, doctors and all the other staff that work on the ward were fantastic. My partner, daughter and I can't thank you enough for the amazing care I received.  
I'm now home, safe and well and think every day of how things might have been different if I hadn't come to see you when I did. Thank you to all in critical care and ward 107 where I finished my stay!  
Since then, everything has changed dramatically. The arrival of this new virus has hit us all and I just wanted to say a huge thank you. Our NHS is amazing!

author: Estuary
title: Great treatment
body:
I rang for advice and said I worked for North West Ambulance Service.  
From ringing Garston Walk in, being given number for referral to being told if you can get here in the next 20mins I would be seen. I received great care, very quick, efficient and reassuring. In the midst of a pandemic, the centre gave me a mask before being triaged, pretty much as soon as I got there and I was examined and on my way within 15 mins with a splint for support. I was also told if there was no improvement in 4 days please call back.Many thanks for great treatment.

author: H7
title: The arrival of our new baby at the BGH
body: We recently had the pleasure of our baby boy joining us - 2 weeks early. We are local to the BGH so this was the hospital we attended. From an initial worry at 11 weeks, to our regular scans and additional scans towards the end due to other reasons our whole experience with the ladies in the PAU, Labour & Maternity ward were out of this world. During our various appointments, labour and after the birth itself we met various different members of staff and we are delighted to say every single one of them were amazing. What an absolute credit to NHS Borders. Nothing was ever a worry, no question ever not relevant, clear & concise information & guidance at all times. We simply can not thank them enough for making our journey much easier and comforting during our first pregnancy as well as during the current pandemic. You guys are absolutely amazing, thank you so much for everything you done for us.

title: Having a bad day
body: Iv been feeling suicidal today. Self harmed.   Very low low mood. Tried calling breathing space, heard a lady very briefly & got cut off. Never got a chance to speak. Just sums up my day/week.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: CcBb
title: What a great team
body:
Skin cancer removal- during a covid pandemic. Appointment through quickly, Staff made me feel safe, everything was explained.  
I felt very trusting of Kirsty & Pam. Wow what a great team made me feel reassured.

title: Great practice
body: During March 2020 my uncle was admitted on two separate occasions undergoing assessment in A&E, on the respiratory unit and stays on E56. As visits to see him were not allowed due to the current restrictions under Coronavirus rules, I relied on communication from the hospital staff. Both times they were brilliant. I was kept fully informed in a totally professional way of my uncle’s condition and treatment plan. At all times it was explained what was needed to be done and why. Whenever possible I was asked for my views / agreement. Courteous, caring and compassionate staff. I can feel completely confident that he received the best of care. I think that during these very difficult days , the effort put in by all staff who spoke to me was outstandingly good. My thanks, my family’s thanks to all the staff.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

author: Dionnex
title: Always at the other end of the phone
body: My dad has been quite unwell with covid-19. He was discharged from hospital on Tuesday and on top of the covid he managed to get tonsillitis which has set him back in his recovery. Some of the symptoms he displayed I was worried about so I picked up the phone and called 111 and the staff were so helpful. He was quite unwell last night so we phoned to get some advice. The call handler Sarah was brilliant she was so reassuring and she spoke to the senior charge nurse whilst I was on the phone and made a plan of action. Sarah had told me to phone 111 if I’m worried about my dad or if anything changes. Within 15 minutes I had the doctor phone to speak with my dad. I have to say that NHS 24 have been great through this and we are honestly so grateful. It’s reassuring for me to know that I can pick up the phone at any point and get advice or speak to someone. I’m really impressed with NHS 24 and they’ve definitely been there for us through what has and continues to be a scary time.

author: Dionnex
title: Great care
body:
I had to phone NHS 24 for my dad as he’d been unwell for a number of days and self care advice wasn’t very effective. As a healthcare worker myself I know how stretched and busy services like NHS 24 are and I only waited about 40 minutes before getting through to a lovely call handler. I can’t remember his name but he was very good he asked all the important questions and he reassured me that he would make sure my dad got the best possible care and help. He spoke to the senior charge nurse and they said a doctor would call me back. I was so surprised as within 10 minutes of ending the call with the call handler the doctor phoned. They spoke to my dad and were thorough on the phone before deciding that they needed to see him in person an appointment was arranged for 2340 which was very quick especially from the time the call was made. I’m very impressed with NHS 24 and LUCS especially given that times are very tough with covid-19.  
He was then admitted to ward 72 at the Western and then moved to ward 74 after being confirmed that he tested positive for covid-19. He was well looked after in both wards and he said staff were really good. We are really grateful to the staff that looked after him and we are so glad to have him back home with us. Thank you so much. X

author: Twinsplustwo
title: My elderly father's recent admission
body:
My elderly Dad has advanced vascular dementia. He went to Ipswich Hospital last week because the carer called the doctor as he’d slept all day and it was difficult to rouse. In context however, with my Mum being taken by paramedics to A and E with severe atrial fibrillation at 2am that same day it’s not surprising he was extra tired, but decisions had been made when I arrived at the house. He *had* been getting progressively more sleepy the past fortnight but he is nearly 93 and has advanced dementia, so I had’t been unduly worried.  
Dad was taken to A and E by ambulance as the paramedics suspected he’d had a TIA - he was awake when he left us. No one was allowed to go to hospital with him, he was not allowed to take anything in, but despite the paramedics taking my number and being aware of the situation when he was admitted, twice I was told (by an A and E Dr. and a Brantham Ward nurse) they thought my mum was still in hospital, and that no one had a contact number for me. I have both financial and health and welfare Power of Attorney for both my parents and it’s vital that information is passed on accurately. They also thought it was his third admission yet he hadn’t been in hospital for over 45 years and never in Ipswich…  
The assessment unit STILL thought mum was in hospital and whilst waiting for the CT results they told me he was going to Washbrook Ward, which was a green ward. They told me I “was lucky” the referral to the ward had been accepted - which I thought was odd at the time. We were still under the impression they thought he had had a mini stroke at this point. It was tough getting info but apparently they did a chest X ray (routine I think?) and we were told it was clear later and all his tests were normal. I did ask on Saturday if his CT scan did not show a TIA, if he had a clear chest X Ray (no chest infection), his blood test inflammatory markers were ok and his urine sample was clear as we'd been told and he’s been assessed by the therapy team then surely he should be home? It didn’t even sound as if I was speaking to someone about the right patient - reduced oxygen levels were mentioned but we’ve not been told he’s ill?  
Then on Monday we were told the x ray was not clear and they thought he had COVID, he had a temperature and his oxygen levels were low so he was to remain in until at least Friday. However only an hour later the ward consultant called me the chest x ray was fine, he hadn't needed oxygen and they didn't think he had COVID - and indeed he had tested negative. Anyway we were told he was safe on a GREEN ward, which was actually incorrect, it turned out later the ward was a red COVID ward!  
I called so many times, different info every time, he had a temperature, didn’t have a temperature, needed oxygen, didn’t need oxygen, he was happy, he was agitated and very difficult to manage… I explained he was very, very confused at the best of times but they said he had 1:1 care because he was the only patient on a bay of 6 beds so I expected them to be looking after him. The therapy team called on Saturday and were helpful, we discussed what his usual state was etc and I believed they were still trying to determine whether he had had a TIA, whether he was worse than usual and when he could come home. The lack of information was frustrating, but theMISinformation was infuriating.  
Then we had a call Monday to say he was going to a “bridging” assessment bed before a care home as it was unsafe for him to come home. Bearing in mind we had not seen him, he had nothing familiar with him etc it's not surprising he was so confused, no one knew why he’d been admitted and assumed it was his delirium. They were *still* basing decision making on incorrect info that it was his third admission, mum was in hospital etc. I explained *again* that this was all incorrect, that whatever happened going forward he had to come home first and this was agreed after literally hours on the phone. I was told there had been some "misinformation" by the physiotherapist who said we should have had a call from the DIST team prior to this.  
He came home yesterday and oh my GOD what a state he was in. Covered in poo, no shower or shave for 5 days, and worst of all covered in severe bruises, plus three dressings on his arms for skin tears. He was exhausted, shaking and in a bad way. It took nearly 2 hours to get him upstairs and showered, he was very frightened. He shouted when touched and was in pain - NONE of this was the case before admission.  
We were told discharge was conditional on a package of 4 x daily care and the care team who came the first night from the hospital were horrified, and said we must complain. The ward staff cannot explain how he hurt himself, and apologised, said he had been restricted to bed because it was a COVID ward and I assume he is now stiff and has lost mobility as a result. They told me he had 1:1 observation so I asked why that person could not have called to ask what he needed, what might help etc. This is a very difficult time for the NHS, we totally appreciate that but the ward was quiet, there was no excuse for not supporting him appropriately - particularly at a time when no family contact was permitted!!  
Today we learned from the new carers that we have 3 days-3weeks care MAXIMUM, and 3 x 1/2 hr visits only. We were told to cancel our pre-existing care package and are going to be left stranded. We have no care for morning showers now, and in any case you cannot get dad in the shower in half an hour!  
We want to know the following:-  
1) Why was the info passed on from the paramedics disregarded? Why were the corrections I gave not recorded?  
2) Why was he admitted if his CT did not show a stroke?  
3) Why was he admitted to a "red" ward? The ward sister said he showed no obvious signs and they were quite good at spotting those with COVID.  
4) Why were we told he was admitted to a green ward?  
5) Why were we persistently told conflicting information?  
6) Why was a discharge plan made without our involvement to a care home, based on inaccurate info which I had repeatedly corrected?  
7) If he was the only patient on a 6 bed bay how on earth did he get so injured? If it is age related etc why do the experienced community care team think we should complain ?  
8) WHY were we told to cancel pre-existing care and promised 8 WEEKS of 4 visits daily? Care team say this happens all the time, the hospital promise things they can’t deliver - but we never asked for care and should not have been told to cancel pre-existing care.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very caring
body: My stepfather has been in this care home for over 6 months.  The owners,management and all staff have a fantastic warm manner and treat all their residents like family members. Juring Covid 19 the contact and support offered has been exceptional.  Many thanks to everyone there we could not have chosen a more perfect caring home.

title: Rude secretaries
body: I tried to use the Dr.iQ app as requested (to avoid calling the surgery) but, due to an issue with the app, it was impossible to make an online consultation. This needs to be investigated and resolved. When I called the surgery to book an online consultation the secretaries were rude and unhelpful. They did not listen to (or try to understand) the issue I had experienced with the app, and I doubt they will escalate it to the appropriate person. They also refused to arrange an appointment for me, asking me to try again with the app in a few weeks time (?!) and pretty much hung up on me! Incredibly unhelpful. They need more training and/or feedback about their poor performance.

title: Receptionist Rude Rude Rude
body:
Not only happened once but its has happen several times that few receptionist who works here  is not only unhelpful but very rude. They don’t know how to speak to patient on phone or when you walk in. Telephone manner is very very poor and rude. It looks and sounds like they have been dragged to work when they don’t want to.  

Myself i work in Health care sector. 
In GP, receptionist are the first point of contact. People come to or call GP with their health problem. So, try to sound friendly, be polite, nice tone of voice. They are already in pain, stressed and when you speak rudely  its more stressful for them. I have notice when we walk in to gp, few of them looks at you like you are the criminal, please greet them with smile. If you can’t do all this than this might not be your job. Give it to someone who is way better than you. Smiling and being kind to others won’t cost you anything. 

But doctor and nurse has always been very polite and friendly.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing treatment
body: I came in to ward 3a burns unit with a bad burn to my left leg which needed an operation the whole team of people who looked after me from start to finish were amazing they all deserve a special medal they were fantastic my name is Dave I think they will remember me.thank you all so much and I was discharged the day before my 60th wedding anniversary.thank you all

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Disgusting
body: Rude receptionist, dismissive and inconsiderate. 111 paramedic had to ring to arrange an urgent appointment after the receptionist said there was no appointments or chance to speak to a doctor until 3 days. The doctor was extremely rude and unprofessional, did not explain the procedure or carry out basic observations. Also said when I raised concerns, ‘what do you want me to do’. Disgusting, unprofessional, don’t work for the NHS if you don’t care about helping people.

title: 2 metre rule
body:
Dermatology staff excellent and meticulous complying where possible the 2 metre rule.
Unfortunately many staff in the corridors between multi storey carpark and department s were walking 2 and 3 abreast not giving oncoming patients space and not even acknowledging our presence who were walking single file. Sorry about the complaints but my wife and myself felt really scared re covid-19.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful staff, wonderful care
body: I have been in contact with both medical and non-medical staff for the passed 2 weeks regarding treatment for my elderly mother.  On all 3 occasions queries have been dealt with promptly and with a great deal of care for her well-being.

title: Absolutely amazing
body: My husband was admitted to ICU 7th april 2020 with COVID 19.After 3 very long weeks and having daily updates from a very special lady he was finally allowed to leave ICU and go on to a regular ward.I can not thank the doctors and nurses that enabled him to come back to us.Thank you for everything you have done for him you truly are all Angel's and worth you weight in gold,again thank you so much for the care you gave him.

title: Rude receptionist
body:
I've been in this GP for 3 years and the receptionists have always been really rude. Today I came early for a blood test and the receptionist first told me to sit down then proceeded to kick me out in a bad way because I was too early and the nurse wasn't there yet. I can understand they are not taking risks due to coronavirus but there is no need to treat patients like rubbish. I've been waiting in the street with cold weather for more than half an hour because everything is obviously closed due to pandemic. When I came back there was a patient waiting in the reception when she said I couldn't do so and she was still disrespectful. 

It's not the first time I deal with this rude woman, they should really check what kind of people are in the reception.

title: Poor patient welfare
body: Visit ASU twice in one week, first time sent home as no CT scan available. Returned next day for scan, sent home again by Radiology.  2 hours later ward called saying need to go back ASAP.  Remained on ASU for 5 hours and not even offered a drink of water.  Ward wasn’t too overcrowded - staff seen gathered round nursing station discussing annual leave rota and how soon until shift ended.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing Staff
body: I was so nervous going into a laparoscopy, I had the most amazing anaesthetist who reassured me the whole way. He was so gentle and reassuring while I was going under, it felt like seconds and then I was waking up! I was seen quickly and efficiently in the Emergency Room too, being only 18 and quite overwhelmed by all my treatment but every staff has been absolutely amazing in my care!

title: Fantastic service
body: I ordered my repeat prescription on line at 10.15am 30th April ant it was delivered by a very friendly gentleman at 3pm the same day! Now that's what I call excellent service. Very well done to all concerned who are coping so well with the added demand this current situation is throwing at them. Keep up the good work!

title: Wonderful service
body: I was recently diagnosed with appendicitis thanks to one of the GPs at The Family Practise. Despite it being during the corona virus pandemic the GP was very thorough and kind. Since having my appendix removed at a local hospital, 2 other GPS have been extremely helpful in prescribing antibiotics for a wound infection and giving advice over telephone consultation. I would just like to say thank you - I have nothing but praise for these doctors!

title: Excellent practice
body: I did an online consultation with the practise where I filled out details of my symptoms on an online form and answered questions. I did this at 11.30am today and was phoned by my GP at 2.30pm on the same day who gave me a telephone consultation after reading my online form submission. They prescribed me antibiotics I can pick up straight from Boots today so I'm really pleased with the help I got today.

title: Great treatment and advice.
body:
I approached Freedom Clinics when I developed some knee pain whilst running. They were able to quickly diagnose the problem, treat the pain and give me some vital tips and exercises to ensure it resolved quickly.
Everyone I had contact with were friendly and professional and I felt reassured that I was in good hands.
Would thoroughly recommend!

title: Great practice
body:
I have been with Greenfield Medical centre for about 5 years now. Before I had a different practice but then I moved house, so I can say the difference. 
Doctors here are all well prepared and caring, there are some young in training but they always refer to the old GPs before you leave. I had a pregnancy and they followed me any time I need to see someone. All my family is registered with this practice and even now with the lockdown we were able to see a doctor by video call. Of course there are few appointments available per day and they are extremely busy but that's because of the high number of patients they need to serve and I am sure they do their best every day. 
Receptionists are lovely and they must do a very hard job dealing every day with enquiries! 
So far, I have nothing to complain. Thank you for your help. 

A happy patient of the practice.

title: Excellent service
body: I have recently visited the Eye Clinic, where I received top class service from the Staff. They were caring, understanding and made me feel at ease during my treatment. Could not have wished to have been in better hands. Follow up to date has been excellent.

title: Totally Professional
body: My son had a minor op upstairs in the medical practice this week. The team were fab from arrival through to saying goodbye. Nurse and care assistant put my son and myself at ease and we’re so lovely. They even allowed me to film the procedure. The doctor/surgeon did a great job and the result can already clearly be seen. Thank you so much 😊

title: Good practice
body: The practice gave me my blood form and is good at giving me my choice of treatment which is of greatest importance.

title: Rude receptionist tried to keep me from booking…
body: I visited the GP and he instructed me to book an appointment with the nurse to have administered the treatment that I needed to have. One receptionist, was very kind, patient and helpful. Then another receptionist got involved. She did everything in her power to keep me from booking the appointment there - which had been requested by my GP from that practice! She kept trying to outsource my treatment to other places and refusing to book the appointment, or postponing saying she wouldnt book it then but that I could come back another time to book it. I patiently explained that i would still wish to book it now and I am aware that it takes some time to get appointments, especially after regular working hours. She said in an angry tone "oh no it doesn't". Of course in the end the earliest appointment they had was in a week's time so there was no need to be rude as my concern about the waiting time was justified. Even if it wasn' though she still had no justificarion for being rude. I had to request for the appintment to be booked multiple times and this lady was frankly rude and unhelpful all the way through.

title: Great receptionists
body: I needed to have a word about my medicine the young lady answered the phone right away and sorted my problem out very efficiently and quickly i like to thank the surgery reception staff

title: Fantastic service during pandemic
body:
I would like to thank all the staff that recently looked after me at the GI unit.  I was referred by my GP for possible blocked bile duct and within 2 weeks I’d had my CT scan and the results.  Within 2 days of receiving the results I’d had an endoscopy and an ERCP procedure.  Under the current circumstances and the strain that this pandemic is putting on the NHS I cannot thank them enough for the speed that they diagnosed, treated and gave follow up care.  The team were all so lovely, professional and caring.  They could not have treated me any quicker or any better.  They all did a fantastic job & thanks to their swift treatment I can honestly say that I am feeling 90% better after just 7 days from having the blockage removed.  I will unfortunately have to have my gallbladder removed in the future but for now I’m on the mend.  We all know the great work that the doctors, nurses & everyone else that work within the hospital do on a normal day but at this time there is nothing normal about the amazing work they’re all doing.  You put your life on the line every day to help care for us with our many different problems & I thank you because without you I would still be severely jaundice, in constant pain and discomfort, not able to eat or get out of bed!!
You are all amazing super human hero’s and I hope you all stay safe & remain healthy.  Keep up the amazing work and again, THANK YOU xx

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Saved my life
body:
Apologies that this review is so late but didn’t know you could leave feedback!

I attended A&E in September 2019 after being ill for 3 weeks and visiting my GP 3 times during that time with what they diagnosed as a viral throat infection.  I was eventually diagnosed with tonsillitis on the Friday of the 3rd week and given antibiotics.  Unfortunately by the Sunday I was poorly that my parents made the decision to take me to A&E as I couldn’t even tolerate water!  When arriving at A&E I was out in the urgent waiting area, I must have looked very poorly.  Within an hour I was called into cubicles where 2 nurses assessed me and told me that my tonsils were so swollen and infected that they were touching and had closed my airway and I was borderline sepsis.  I was seen within 5 mins by a doctor who gave me IV antibiotics, steroid injection and I have no idea what else.  I was put on oxygen to make sure I was able to breathe.  He told me I needed to be admitted and would be transferred by ambulance due to my compromised airway to wolverhampton as there was no ENT admittance at Russell’s Hall on a weekend.  I was so poorly that I didn’t care what they did to me or where they needed to send me.  I was just so grateful that I was actually being taken serious and was getting the treatment that I so desperately needed.  I have suffered from tonsillitis since I was a child but I have never experienced anything like this and had my parents left it another few hours then I don’t know what would have happened but I genuinely believe that the outcome would have been very different & I would have been septic!!  

The staff were all amazing, including the receptionist that made the decision that I was so poorly that I needed to be seen urgently.  That decision was the difference from being seen within the hour and waiting up to 3 hrs for “normal” waiting time on that afternoon.  I did say thank you when I was well enough after being released from hospital where I spent 4 days with chocolates (which is always a winner) but I want to show my gratitude again to the amazing NHS staff. Your fast action and professional I believe literally saved my life and all from tonsillitis. Thank you, thank you, thank you xx

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Best blood test
body: I want to leave feedback for a recent blood test appointment with Nurse E . - Best blood test ever! No pain and/or fainting (me or E) thank you. I always seem to have very pleasant experiences since being a patient at your surgery. You are all lovely.

title: Worcester Hospital’s fab Cath Lab and Laurel 1…
body: From 6pm at home having a heart attack to being sorted out in the Cath Lab and on the ward by 9:30pm,what more can we ask from these great, talented and committed people. Due to their care and speedy attention I am making an excellent recovery. I am forever grateful to them especially during these trying times 😀

title: Supportive staff
body:
When I first found out I was pregnant I was in shock I never slept for three days before I made my first call to Marie Stopes.

The first call I made they made me feel at ease and a few days later I had my telephone consultation.

The midwife was very understanding and explained in good detail on how I will take the pills once they arrived.

I took the pills three days ago, even though it was a very hard decision I knew it was the best for me in my current circumstances. I felt very supportive from Marie Stopes and having a 24hr helpline put my mind at ease as I never told anyone else about my decision.

Thank you Marie Stopes for being there at a time in my life where I’ve never felt so lost and confused.

title: Peggy Wood clinic
body: What a great unit this is treated with respect and professionalism even in these terrible times  Hospital very clean with social distancing in place could not fault my visit

title: let  down today01052020  no  heart monitor review…
body:
i usually  have  praise  for the hospital  but  today  i have been let down 

i was due  my 6 weekly  heart monitor review  today  by phone  but have  had no contact  at all today    the original   heart monitor had been inserted  inthe  wrong place  and  i had to have 
 theop done again  i had a letter  advising  that  due to the virus there heart monitor  review  would be done over the phone  on may ist  i doi have a few  issues  i needed  clarified  so to hear nothing  i feel is  appauling

title: Caring GPs
body: I've found my GP at this practice to be excellent. There isn't an obvious solution to my health issues and they always work with me to look at solutions. It's much appreciated!

title: Compassionate Care
body:
I’ve been a patient at this surgery for years but have never really required any services, thankfully. Since the beginning of the pandemic I have been suffering with worsening anxiety and eventually sought the practice for some help. 
Since my first telephone appointment, I’ve spoken to the same lovely Physician Associate 4 times and they have been nothing but accommodating and patient in regards to my worries. Whether it’s first thing on a Monday or last thing on a Friday I’ve found that my care has never faltered.
I just want to write this to thank the practice as a whole for being so great during these current times, and to also wish a personal thanks to this lovely person who has been helping me for the last 6 weeks. 

Keep being fantastic, Holmside. Also, kudos on having such a varying multidisciplinary team (I see from these reviews you also have an advanced paramedic!)- It’s nice to see practices embracing the different roles out there. Hopefully the same can be said for elsewhere soon!

title: Great Service
body:
My name is doreen on monday 27th april
I made a same day consultation the doctor rang me at around 10am.i was in a lot of pain.the doctor asks me several questions.and sent a prescription to my local chemist within 5 mins.the service I got from this surgery was so good. Excellent in fact. The percription was collected same day.. and started to work within 24hours
I cannot thank the doctor enough . She was kind sympathetic and professional
Thank you so much your all amazing there doreen mcloughlin

title: Rapid and caring
body: I had an issue during Corona and this practise was extremely swift in dealing with me over the phone and finding an ultrasound scan for me. The same day as the scan, they got the results and phoned back, they had a referral for me the following day. Within a week, I've had the orchidectomy. Very caring and focussed team wanting urgent care for their patients

title: Woweeee thank you NHS
body: Brilliant from beginning to end. My little boy was seen quickly for a laceration on his hand. Everyone was so kind and caring towards us both. We were referred to Broomsfield hospital for continued plastic surgery who were also wonderful. Thank you every single NHS worker for all you give everyday x

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good service
body:
Due to covid 19 restrictions I had several telephone consultations with a doctor. 
Arranging these with the reception staff was very easy and courteously done.
The doctors called at the agreed times, answered all my questions and was able to advise of the appropriate treatment.

title: Thorough service
body: I had a appointment for an ultra scan. The staff were all professional. The two members of staff who carried out my scan were lovely and very thorough with my examination. They made me feel comfortable and able to ask questions as they carried out the scan. I was happy with my overall experience.

title: terrible and possibly life threatening
body: it is second time in last 6 months when I asked for a repeat prescription only to find out in pharmacy that only some items were issued, angin Insulin was missing. Luckily, diabetes it is not a "life threatening" disease, but I can only imagine what if the same happens to patients who have more serious conditions? I asked for prescription on Sunday, it's Friday afternoon, so gave them 5 days notice for prescription, but took last dose of insulin this morning. Emailed them twice today, no response. I was going to file an official complaint when it happened last year, but I was persuaded not to and gave them another chance, however is seems like the lesson was not learned... shame...

title: First class treatment
body: This morning I had to attend the A&E Department at WHH..I was dealt with with kindness & compassion by all of the staff members who were involved in investigating my illness..I would like to particularly compliment the lady doctor from Nigeria with the red hair who spent a considerable amount of time with me discussing results of my blood analysis & x-ray..& any further investigation that might be needed..she also kindly spoke to and updated my own GP who telephoned during the consultation. People are often quick to criticise the NHS, although quite the contrary at the moment, so I would like to pass on my heartfelt thanks(clue!) to all of the members of the A&E Staff today who were instrumental in my care. Terry

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body:
I had minor surgery today, and can't thank the guys in the dermatologist and cancer department enough, the guys and girls who work behind the scenes doing all the content and communication and for the amazing professional surgeon who carried out the operation so reassuring 
Thank you so much

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Lovely staff who really care about what they do and every single member of the team delivers excellent service. I seem to be someone who has a odd illnesses, and they’ve always been persistent about getting to the bottom of each issue. Kind, caring and all around brilliant.

title: Excellent treatment from Urgent Treatment Centre
body:
Date of visit 01/05/2020 in the morning.
I was booked in quickly by the helpful receptionist who was on duty.
Very short waiting time to see one of the clinicians who was on duty.
The clinician was very thorough and quickly diagnosed I was suffering from an abrasion on the eye and prescribed eye ointment.
The treatment I received was very much appreciated and I would like to say a big thank you to clinician who treated my injury.
Finally thanks for providing an excellent service during the pandemic.
Yours one happy patient.

title: Excellent care
body:
In 2016 /17 you looked after my partner John Unsworth who had terminal lung care the care, support and treatment you gave was an incredible comfort to him.
I appreciate that as a respiratory ward during COVID-19 the demands on you must be unimaginable. I just wanted to express my thanks for all you do. Clare Usher

title: Wonderful doctor
body: After having a horrible experience with HRT and not being pointed in the right direction with the medication it landed me up in hospital! I was quite poorly . But after being recommended to see a amazing doctor there that listened to you , took time to read past medical history at last I have to say this doctor changed my life and I cannot thank her enough !!! I have now changed my life ! So thank you x

title: Amazing care
body: We had an unexpected case of Intra Uterine Fetal Death (late miscarriage) at 20 weeks. The team at Lincoln County Hospital took amazing care, leading up to and throughout the induced labour, and beyond. Have never felt safer or more cared for. In particular, the midwives and supporting staff were incredible. Thank you.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Wonderful Staff
body: Had to visit a and e today as woke up with palpitations. From start to finish the staff were amazing. I suffer with anxiety and the two nurses and dr I saw were incredible. I hadn’t realised the severity of my anxiety but they have helped me so much and made me understand I need to get help and not be ashamed or embarrassed by how I am feeling. I’ve been hiding it away for probably years now and without thier kind words and advice I think I still probably would be. They are absolutely worth their weight in gold and I just want to thank them so much.

title: Lovely GPs very bad pharmacy
body: Very discussed with the pharmacy was told my father would recieve his tablets Thursday which is when the Doctor wanted him to start taking them he has cancer liver and kidney problems and can not leave the house. I'm the only person that can collect them however my little girl is unwell and we need to self isolate.  I'm very angry at the way I was spoken to at the pharmacy on two occasions regarding this matter. I do appreciate the diffecult circumstances way are dealing with at the moment.  However people have been offering there services to volunteer so I dont understand why this pharmacy had not put more procedures in place. My fathers tablets are only for seven days then a telephone appointment with his GP. I do feel this lack of support is dangerous and playing with people's lives and feel this needs to be a addressed

title: Addenbrooke’s Treatment Centre
body: Just left after five days of excellent care and surgery. The staff were knowledgeable, caring and didn’t make me feel like I was an inconvenience, something I’ve felt at other hospitals in the past. All staff, nurses, assistants, doctors, porters, etc, were wonderful. My surgeon explained everything in minute detail and was diligent in checking up on me. I cannot recommend them enough.

title: 2 Week Wait
body: I was referred to Respiratory under the 2 week rule about the 2nd week of January expecting to be seen within 2 weeks.  Previously my Rheumatologist had referred me for chest CT this was arranged for February 6th.  I called the Respiratory department after waiting more than 3 weeks and they told me they had not arranged anything urgent and I would be seen for CT as arranged by the Rheumatologist.  This came back showing a nodule on my lung.  They told me they did not think this was cancer but wanted to perform another scan in 2 months to see if there were any changes.  This second scan was cancelled due to Covid.  I spoke to a lovely nurse who managed to get the scan reinstated.  Following the 2nd scan I was referred for a PET scan and I have now been diagnosed with small cell cancer of the right lung.  I am at a loss to understand why I was referred under the 2 week rule for suspected lung cancer but had to wait 4 months for a diagnosis.   Thank fully there is a good possibility that this is operable and curable.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Suggestion
body: My husband received excellent care ..however getting information on his condition was difficult due to the no visitor rule phone signals are iffy in parts of the hospital ..the wards phones are always busy so what about using some unused outpatient phones to let volunteers take and give messages ..if the ward Clark sends a list to the point of contact things like hhad a good night eating etc to pass to relatives and Visa versa the volunteers could have a slips to give to patients no big messages just granny sends love or even try to ring home ...a few people have mentioned this is a problem especially when they have older people in

title: Absolute shambles from top to bottom
body:
Doctors do not come out to elderly patients.
Doctors refuse to speak to patients families.
Staff not interested in complaints.
Staff do not answer phones.
Would not go there EVER again.

author: strattons236
title: Thank you for helping me.
body:
I have had a stoma for 7 years now following long hospitalisation after bowel cancer surgery. My most anxious times are when I have to reorder my stoma 'gear'. Over the years I have tried various methods and had some big disappointments, sometimes having to reorder because the prescription has been lost in transit. The fear is always that I will run out of one of the many accoutrements that are necessary.  
Since Trupti took over and I send in my request to her, the prescription gets sent regularly and quickly and the acknowledgements come through very quickly as do the parcels. I have told Trupti how grateful I am and for doing her job so well but she says it is just her job, I want her managers to know how grateful I am. For me, having suffered many failures on the prescription front over the years it is a massive relief to find a sytem through Trupti of solving my anxiety and producing the goods with what is proving to be a fail safe system! !  
Thank you for helping me.

title: Great Service
body: Very good, professional service, would like to thank all the staff and highly recommend. Many thanks.

title: An amazing service
body: I received the best care from this surgery when having a worry about my health recently. The reception staff were extremely supportive and kind and the GP went out of his way to help me with my worry. I feel that my health concern was taken seriously and I was given so much support and advice. I cannot thank the GP and practice enough for their help during this time.

title: Always listens
body: Although I recently had a slight 'blip' with the surgery I've always found my GP very helpful and, most importantly, willing to listen and discuss any concerns with me.  This has been the case with the problem I recently encountered and which has now been resolved. I appreciate my GPs workload is heavy but I find he always makes time to inform me of my options and is always willing to listen to my opinion, for which I am grateful.  It's great to have somebody like this who I can trust and I appreciate his support

title: Amazing care
body:
Ever since registering at this GP practice it has been nothing short of excellent.  I was worried due to having complex mental health issues and having a long prescription and numerous mental health care pathways at place in Derbyshire.  Within 2 weeks of registering at the practice I had a telephone appt. with one of the doctors who processed my referral to mental health secondary care in Lancashire that same day, a repeat prescription for my 9 medications ready and a call from the local psychiatric nurse network following the GP referral to discuss my care.  She spent 30 mins on the phone to me and immediately referred me on to long term psychaitric tertiary care  that same day.

I understand the final referral will take time... but what took Whittle surgery 2 weeks to organise took my old primary care provider in Derbyshire 18 months to do so.

title: Great service and consideration
body: I contacted the surgery this morning to advise the receptionist of my injury. She said a doctor would contact me by telephone later today... and he did. He asked me to be as precise as possible about my condition and was able to diagnose at once... and with a sense of humour. Within the hour I had a prescription and was supplied by the local pharmacy. Despite the pressure that the surgery must be under with covid 19, they provided time and attention to my condition. I have read several of the reviews most of which give a negative view of the surgery. Time to balance the view of this practice. I have nothing but high praise for the receptionist to the doctor and finally to the pharmacy all of whom deserve my grateful thanks for their prompt and professional response.

title: Helpful Practice
body: Hard to get appointments but I managed to make myself book an appointment for an issue I had been postponing. When i visited practice for my appointment, doctor listened carefully and took time the to explain everything. Very helpful and understanding. No hesitation in recommending to others

title: First Telephone consultation with my GP
body: Had a telephone consultation with a doctor who listened carefully and took time the to explain everything to me. It was very understanding and actually made me feel relieved, it feels like a complete different experience to get doctor consultation over telephone.

title: Thank You
body: My family and I have been patients at this practice for 3 decades plus. I recall the surgery previously being over at Coventry Road before if moved to the now, prime and land marked location on Cooksey Road. This is indeed a busy practice and I may not always be able to get appointments, however when I do it’s always been with the upmost service and professionalism, from the front staff to the doctors and nurses, who have treated me over the years. When a personal bereavement had taken place, my doctor was swift with their action and their comforting guidance. During this time of COVID-19 I am particularly grateful that my practice has remained in operation. My heartfelt thanks to my doctor and the staff for putting their lives at risk, yet still continuing to provide care and advice for myself and other patients. It is my great hope and wish that this practice continues with its excellent care provision for me, my household, the next generation of my family and all current and future patients, that walk through its doors. Thank you for being there for us and thank you for all that you do and all that you shall be doing in the future.

title: Fabulous!
body: I had cause to visit A n E for suspected heart attack.  I couldn’t be anymore grateful to all the staff who dealt with me literally 3 seconds to see triage nurse 7 minutes to see a doctor.  All the staff I saw were upbeat in this difficult time due to Coronavirus but I felt they took time for me and I just wanted to say you all do a brilliant job from reception through to nursing staff and doctors.  Keep it up and hopefully I will have no call to return

title: Caring and professional service
body: Elderly relative had to visit A&E after a fall on their own. Ambulance crew could not have been nicer and looked after relative with so much love and care. A&E doctor rang and kept us up to date throughout what was a long day both for relative and staff.  The level of professional and care for the elderly relative went over and beyond the call of duty and they returned home that night having been thoroughly checked over and looked after.  After initial reservations of the relative having to go it alone - which we quite understood in the current climate our mind was put to rest when we collected our relative and would have no hesitation in going to A & E again as it was well organised, all measures were in place and safe for all concerned.  Thank you for everything you did we cannot thank you enough as despite everything you have going on your level of care was outstanding.

readBy.name: Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing.
body: Visited Marie Stopes Maidstone in a time of fear and upset and they made the entire process easy and even managed to make me laugh at such a distressing time. Grace was amazing and her kindness and care will always be cherished by me - thank you so so much.

title: Superb care & thankyou
body:
As a nervous patient, first time at Dental Hospital. The dental nurse was very attentive and caring. The dentist explained everything he would be doing and made sure I was happy with it. He made me very at ease as I was very nervous,  as did the dental nurse. I wish I could name them as they were marvellous and would highly recommend. Thankyou for helping me and taking my pain away. I wish you so much luck in your future venture as a dentist and thankyou to all staff from going in to leaving. It cant be easy in the current climate and you made everything smooth and reassuring.
A big well done and thumbs up from me.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Always try and halp
body: Always try and help to sort out any problems,i for one think they do a wonderful job,for me and my husband,been with this practice near on 50 years x

title: Usually good
body: This hospital has helped to save many lives of family members. I know they are under intense strain at the moment due to the Covid19 situation. A parent was in ICU, in an induced coma as he was coronavirus positive and somebody packed up his belongings to return them to us. Luckily, I wore PPE when opening the bag as I found three used oxygen masks with the tubing. I understand the current strain, but sending these items home to my mother (who has no immune system due to cancer and is extremely vulnerable) and myself wasn't acceptable as the item is likely contaminated and put us at risk!

title: Wonderful
body: I felt ill while out on a walk. Ambulance drivers and Gloucester A & E doctors and nurses were calm, friendly, supportive and kind. I have nothing but praise for the way I was supported and helped. Thank you!
